docs.title: bertron-schema
docs.text:
LinkML schema for ber data intergration work

URI: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema

Name: bertron-schema

docs.title: Classes
docs.text: Class Description DatasetCollection A holder for Dataset objects NamedThing A generic grouping for any identifiable entity Dataset Represents a Dataset

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Slot Description age_in_years Number of years since birth birth_date Date on which a person is born description A human-readable description for a thing entries id A unique identifier for a thing name A human-readable name for a thing primary_email The main email address of a person vital_status living or dead status

docs.title: Enumerations
docs.text: Enumeration Description PersonStatus

docs.title: Types
docs.text: Type Description Boolean A binary (true or false) value Curie a compact URI Date a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar DateOrDatetime Either a date or a datetime Datetime The combination of a date and time Decimal A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal speci... Double A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification Float A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification Integer An integer Jsonpath A string encoding a JSON Path Jsonpointer A string encoding a JSON Pointer Ncname Prefix part of CURIE Nodeidentifier A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model Objectidentifier A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model Sparqlpath A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path String A character string Time A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular... Uri a complete URI Uriorcurie a URI or a CURIE

docs.title: Subsets
docs.text: Subset Description

docs.text:
A binary (true or false) value

docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self xsd:boolean native bertron_schema:boolean exact schema:Boolean

docs.title: Type: Curie
docs.text:
a compact URI

URI: xsd:string

  • base: Curie

  • uri: xsd:string

  • repr: str

docs.title: Comments
docs.text:
• in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
  • in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self xsd:string native bertron_schema:curie

docs.title: Class: Dataset
docs.text:
Represents a Dataset

URI: bertron_schema:Dataset

 classDiagram
    class Dataset
    click Dataset href "../Dataset"
      NamedThing <|-- Dataset
        click NamedThing href "../NamedThing"

      Dataset : age_in_years

      Dataset : birth_date

      Dataset : description

      Dataset : id

      Dataset : name

      Dataset : primary_email

      Dataset : vital_status




    Dataset --> "0..1" PersonStatus : vital_status
    click PersonStatus href "../PersonStatus"

docs.title: Inheritance
docs.text:
• NamedThing
    • Dataset

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Cardinality and Range Description Inheritance primary_email 0..1  String The main email address of a person direct birth_date 0..1  Date Date on which a person is born direct age_in_years 0..1  Integer Number of years since birth direct vital_status 0..1  PersonStatus living or dead status direct id 1  Uriorcurie A unique identifier for a thing NamedThing name 0..1  String A human-readable name for a thing NamedThing description 0..1  String A human-readable description for a thing NamedThing

docs.title: Usages
docs.text: used by used in type used DatasetCollection entries range Dataset

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema

docs.title: Mappings
docs.text: Mapping Type Mapped Value self bertron_schema:Dataset native bertron_schema:Dataset

docs.title: Direct
docs.text:
name: Dataset
description: Represents a Dataset
from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
is_a: NamedThing
slots:
- primary_email
- birth_date
- age_in_years
- vital_status
slot_usage:
  primary_email:
    name: primary_email
    pattern: ^\S+@[\S+\.]+\S+

docs.title: Induced
docs.text:
name: Dataset
description: Represents a Dataset
from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
is_a: NamedThing
slot_usage:
  primary_email:
    name: primary_email
    pattern: ^\S+@[\S+\.]+\S+
attributes:
  primary_email:
    name: primary_email
    description: The main email address of a person
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:email
    alias: primary_email
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - Dataset
    range: string
    pattern: ^\S+@[\S+\.]+\S+
  birth_date:
    name: birth_date
    description: Date on which a person is born
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:birthDate
    alias: birth_date
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - Dataset
    range: date
  age_in_years:
    name: age_in_years
    description: Number of years since birth
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: age_in_years
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - Dataset
    range: integer
  vital_status:
    name: vital_status
    description: living or dead status
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    alias: vital_status
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - Dataset
    range: PersonStatus
  id:
    name: id
    description: A unique identifier for a thing
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:identifier
    identifier: true
    alias: id
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - NamedThing
    range: uriorcurie
    required: true
  name:
    name: name
    description: A human-readable name for a thing
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:name
    alias: name
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - NamedThing
    range: string
  description:
    name: description
    description: A human-readable description for a thing
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000
    slot_uri: schema:description
    alias: description
    owner: Dataset
    domain_of:
    - NamedThing
    range: string

docs.title: Class: DatasetCollection
docs.text:
A holder for Dataset objects

URI: bertron_schema:DatasetCollection

 classDiagram
    class DatasetCollection
    click DatasetCollection href "../DatasetCollection"
      DatasetCollection : entries




    DatasetCollection --> "*" Dataset : entries
    click Dataset href "../Dataset"

description: A holder for Dataset objects
from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema

    name: entries
    from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
    rank: 1000

    range: Dataset
    multivalued: true
    inlined: true
tree_root: true

docs.title: Type: Jsonpath
docs.text:
A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.

  • uri: xsd:string

docs.title: Type: Jsonpointer
docs.text:

docs.title: Enum: PersonStatus
docs.text: URI: PersonStatus

docs.title: Permissible Values
docs.text: Value Meaning Description ALIVE PATO:0001421 the person is living DEAD PATO:0001422 the person is deceased UNKNOWN None the vital status is not known

docs.title: Slots
docs.text: Name Description vital_status living or dead status

docs.title: Schema Source
docs.text: • from schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema

docs.title: LinkML Source
docs.text:
name: PersonStatus
from_schema: https://w3id.org/ber-data/bertron-schema
rank: 1000
permissible_values:
  ALIVE:
    text: ALIVE
    description: the person is living
    meaning: PATO:0001421
  DEAD:
    text: DEAD
    description: the person is deceased
    meaning: PATO:0001422
  UNKNOWN:
    text: UNKNOWN
    description: the vital status is not known
    todos:
    - map this to an ontology

docs.title: Type: Sparqlpath
docs.text:
A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
